creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
text:
After the merge, the publication.xml file is no longer required as it is no
longer used. However, the build system is checking for its presence. This is
causing a NPE during build if it is not at least a 0 byte file.

Created attachment 19949
Changes test from publication.xml to /config/publication.xconf

config/publication.xconf seemed to be the best option for a file to test for
existance. After the patch ./build.sh compile-build-tasks needs to be ran. The
compiled class files are also store in svn and would need to be updated to svn.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org
nettings@apache.org
text:
applied, with a brown paper bag over my head...
i remember i've tried the very same patch, and it did not work.
only now it dawned on me that this requires a 

# ./build.sh compile-build-tasks

:-D

thanks!

Created attachment 19951
Fixes publication.xml test and NPE

Same comments as before. Added a test so the NPE won't be thrown in the future.
creator: rfrovarp@apache.org

text:
Thanks for this patch.

Unfortunately the class files do not work on Java 1.4.  Any chance of
recompiling/recommitting 1.4 compatible versions?

Thanks
creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com

text:
as a quick workaround, compile them yourself.

i don't quite understand how this can happen, since i have
src.java.version=1.4
(although i do indeed use jdk 1.5.)
but i haven't yet found where "target.vm" gets its value from, so i may be
overlooking something.

i wonder whether this whole thing is worth the hassle. why do we ship pre-built
classfiles again?

can anyone who is using jdk 1.4 provide their classfiles? mail them to nettings
AT apache DOT org, and i'll try them out and commit them...
creator: nettings@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 19953
Java 1.4 Anttask class files

Hi Joern, thanks for your help.

Yes I know I can compile my own classfiles, I just wanted to bring this to
everyone's attention so that it doesn't keep happening ;).

I have attached a zip file with the class files compiled for Java 1.4.

P.S.  I tried mailing them to your apache address but the delivery failed.
creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com

text:
thanks jonathan. i have committed the classes you built, and they work for me.
please test and close the bug if it's ok.
creator: nettings@apache.org

text: Works for me, thanks for committing.
creator: jonathan.addison@wyona.com
